title: How to Run an EXE File at the Windows Command Prompt

steps.title: Find the file path
steps.content: Find the file path of the folder containing your exe program. Open the folder containing your program in a File Explorer window, and copy or note the file path from the address bar at the top of the window.

steps.title: Open your computer's Start menu.
steps.content: Open your computer's Start menu. Click the Start button in the lower-left corner of your desktop to open your Start menu. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Type and search cmd on the Start menu.
steps.content: Type and search cmd on the Start menu. Command Prompt should show up at the top of the search results.

steps.title: Click Command Prompt on the Start menu.
steps.content: Click Command Prompt on the Start menu. This will open a new Command Prompt window. [2] X Research source For example, if you're trying to run Mozilla Firefox , the exe file you want to run may be located in a folder called Mozilla Firefox in Program Files on your C drive. In this case, your file path is C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox .

steps.title: Type cd [filepath] in the command with your program's file path.
steps.content: Type cd [filepath] in the command with your program's file path. Replace [filepath] with the actual path to folder that contains the EXE program you want to run. [3] X Research source For example, if you're trying to run Mozilla Firefox, your command here may look like cd C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox .

steps.title: Hit ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return on your keyboard.
steps.content: Hit ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return on your keyboard. This will navigate you into the selected file path in Command Prompt. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Type start [filename.exe] into Command Prompt.
steps.content: Type start [filename.exe] into Command Prompt. Replace [filename.exe] with your program's name. This should exactly match your exe program's file name in the folder. [5] X Research source For example, if you're running Mozilla Firefox, the program file should be named firefox.exe by default. In this case, your command will look like start firefox.exe .

steps.title: Hit ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return on your keyboard.
steps.content: Hit ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return on your keyboard. This will run the selected program on your computer.
